question_text: You're troubleshooting a system with intermittent crashes after a power supply upgrade. Which TWO steps should be taken to verify connector compatibility? (Select two)
answer_options: Check connector keying to confirm correct physical alignment
Compare PSU and motherboard documentation for pinout details
Verify that all cables are black and sleeved
Ensure the PCIe connectors are gold-plated
Run a GPU stress test without checking cabling first
correct_answer: Check connector keying to confirm correct physical alignment
Compare PSU and motherboard documentation for pinout details
explanation: Connector keying prevents incorrect orientation, but documentation review is essential for verifying voltage delivery and pin function on modular setups.
